title: Canapé Serif – formerly known as Sofa – arrived :-)
content:
Thanks to all the members of this forum that supported me in this project all over the years :-)

It's here (well, the first part is)!  
The microsite: [http://canape.fonts.info/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414111457/http:/canape.fonts.info/ "http://canape.fonts.info/")  
The PDF: [http://fonts.info/pub/pdf/canape-serif-en.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414111457/http:/fonts.info/pub/pdf/canape-serif-en.pdf "http://fonts.info/pub/pdf/canape-serif-en.pdf")  
The PDF at issuu: [http://issuu.com/fonts.info/docs/canape-serif-en?mode=window](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414111457/http:/issuu.com/fonts.info/docs/canape-serif-en?mode=window "http://issuu.com/fonts.info/docs/canape-serif-en?mode=window")

Sebastian
author: Sebastian Nagel

comments.content:
Congrats Sebastian, this looks great!  
I'm seeing some weird alignment issues at certain zooms in the pdf - I know this often comes with the territory, but I wonder if there are alignment zones or other hinting setups that could be changed to help reduce the occurrences.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414111457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hintingproblem_5139.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414111457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kerningproblem2_4260.png)

Lovely. Bought it. Hope you don’t mind I did that thru the cheaper store… : ) (saved me 34 euro).

Plan on using it in a current project.
